intro: Echium humile, commonly known as the narrow-leaved viper's bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy texture. Echium humile is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
